pullRequest.title: Issue 12934: Initial ejbLite-4.0 implemenation
pullRequest.bodyText:
Add necessary transforms for jakarta ee and add required
features to support ejbLite-4.0
Enabled one basic test using repeat action.
for #12934

nodes.bodyText:
I created an convenience method for this that you might wish to try...

  
    
      open-liberty/dev/fattest.simplicity/src/componenttest/rules/repeater/EERepeatTests.java
    
    
         Line 61
      in
      654502a
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public static RepeatTests with(String serverName, EEVersion version, EEVersion... otherVersions) {

I know that the ejb container has kinda been named this way for decades (?!) but would you consider calling this something like io.openliberty.ejb.4.0.internal.container? Something that follows the guidelines here: https://github.com/OpenLiberty/open-liberty/wiki/Open-Liberty-naming-guidelines#examples
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+#*******************************************************************************
+# Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.
+# All rights reserved. This program and the accompanying materials
+# are made available under the terms of the Eclipse Public License v1.0
+# which accompanies this distribution, and is available at
+# http://www.eclipse.org/legal/epl-v10.html
+#
+# Contributors:
+#     IBM Corporation - initial API and implementation
+#*******************************************************************************
+-include= ~../cnf/resources/bnd/bundle.props
+bVersion=1.0
+
+Bundle-Name: Jakarta Enterprise Beans 4.0 Runtime
+Bundle-SymbolicName: io.openliberty.ejbcontainer.v40

nodes.bodyText:
The wiki doesn't have an example for a version specific package name but how about
io.openliberty.ejb.internal.container.v40?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@

+ * Copyright (c) 2020 IBM Corporation and others.

+ *******************************************************************************/
+package io.openliberty.ejbcontainer.v40.internal;
